structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.text: [Text of section effective until March 31, 2012. Repealed by 2008, 521, Sec. 40. See 2008, 521, Sec. 44 as amended by 2010, 409, Sec. 23 and 2011, 224.] All matters of trust of which probate courts have jurisdiction, except those arising under wills, shall be within the jurisdiction of the probate court of any county where any of the parties interested in the trust reside, or where any of the land held in trust is situated; but such jurisdiction, when once assumed, shall exclude the probate court of any other county from taking jurisdiction of any matter subsequently arising in relation to the same trust.
